intro: Anthocleista scheffleri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
